page.title: 06Pig farming
page.content: Some farms in this area have pig units which vary in size from 30-250 sows there are no very big units. Pigs are kept inside controlled environments,often in converted buildings or in purpose built sheds. They are fed on a ration of ground cereals, wheat, barley, soya and fish meal, also whey and skimmed milk. Pigs convert wellif kept in warm well ventilated housing and fed and watered correctly. They are moved around the units from farrowing to weaning houses, fattening and then finally sold for either pork meat or bacon. Some farmers sell the weaners to other farms for fattening. The average litter is 9 and the gestation period 114-118 days, sows make good mothers.
